creator: antonio.bueno@udg.edu
text:
The language links in the documentation don't go to the correct URL. It is not 
evident in the online documentation probably due to a RedirectMatch tweak in 
the conf file. For example go to http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/en/ and hover 
the "en" link (top right, "Available Languages"). It says it will go to ...docs/
2.2/en/en/ :P

In a Win32 setup, I've fixed this inconsistency with these directives: 

AliasMatch ^/manual(?:/(?:de|en|es|fr|ja|ko|pt-br|ru))?(/.*)?$ "C:/Apache/
manual$1"
RedirectMatch 301 ^/manual(?:/(de|en|es|fr|ja|ko|pt-br|ru)){2,}(/.*)?$ /manual/
$1$2

I'm not sure of the best way to fix this inconsistence. At least include 
directives to fix it somewhere in the documentation (an example in mod_alias 
maybe?).
Moving docs bugs to docs@httpd.a.o ownership.
creator: rbowen@apache.org

text:
Yep. It's kinda fixed. The directives I mentioned are in \Apache Software Foundation\Apache2.2\conf\extra\httpd-manual.conf of a just-downloaded Apache 2.2.17 (Win32).

The URLs in the links are still wrong (/en/de/, /en/en/ and so on once you go into /en/) but they work and that's the important part.

text: Creator's note: These links are by design. That way the whole documentation can be stored as static files with relative links (together with the httpd configuation). No other requirement to view the docs other than core, mod_alias, mod_mime, and mod_negotiation (actually mod_negotiation was extended to make it work and go without mod_rewrite ;-).
